metadata.title: CVE-2019-15902 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A backporting error was discovered in the Linux stable/longterm kernel4.4.x through 4.4.190, 4.9.x through 4.9.190, 4.14.x through 4.14.141,4.19.x through 4.19.69, and 5.2.x through 5.2.11. Misuse of the upstream"x86/ptrace: Fix possible spectre-v1 in ptrace_get_debugreg()" commitreintroduced the Spectre vulnerability that it aimed to eliminate. Thisoccurred because the backport process depends on cherry picking specificcommits, and because two (correctly ordered) code lines were swapped.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-66-generic - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-66-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-66-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-66-generic - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-66-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1060-kvm - 4.4.0-1060.67
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1096-aws - 4.4.0-1096.107
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1052-aws - 4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1061-azure - 4.15.0-1061.66
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1047-gcp - 4.15.0-1047.50
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-oracle - 4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1124.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1128-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1128.136
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-66.75~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.67').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1096.107').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.54~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.66').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.50').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.30~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.133').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.136').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
